title: Michael Mistretta
content: I think advertising is a brilliant concept that has been pooped upon by selfish marketers, resulting in corrupted motives and flawed execution.

title: Jessica Hische
content: Every new thing you make will be (should be) the nicest thing you’ve made so far, because you’re learning and getting better with each and every new project.

title: Steve Jobs
content: Design is the fundamental soul of a human-made creation that ends up expressing itself in successive outer layers of the product or service.

title: Donald Rumsfeld
content:
As we know,
There are known knowns.
There are things we know we know.
We also know
There are known unknowns.
That is to say
We know there are some things
We do not know.
But there are also unknown unknowns,
The ones we don’t know
We don’t know.

title: Raphael Henry
content: The same hand can draw art for the sake of emotional expression and design that serves a purpose.

title: Saul Bass
content: There is nothing glamorous in what I do. I’m a working man. Perhaps I’m luckier than most in that I receive considerable satisfaction from doing useful work which I, and sometimes others, think is good.

title: Ralph Caplan
content: [Designers’] primary competence lies not in the technicalities of a craft but in the mastery of a process.

title: Rastko Ciric
content: An inexperienced observer sees everything in a picture; the experienced one sees even the things that are missing.

title: Vital Lokossou
content: Tech without design is the business’s perdition.

title: Greg Hudson
content: It is important not to let the perfect become the enemy of the good, even when you can agree on what perfect is. Doubly so when you can’t. As unpleasant as it is to be trapped by past mistakes, you can’t make any progress by being afraid of your own shadow during design.

title: Antoine de Saint Exupéry
content: Perfection is achieved, not when there is nothing more to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.

title: Albert Einstein
content: We can’t solve problems by using the same kind of thinking we used when we created them.

title: Marc Chagall
content: If I create from the heart, nearly everything works; if from the head, almost nothing.

title: Robert L. Peters
content: Design creates culture. Culture shapes values. Values determine the future.

title: Anthon Beeke
content: Having a style is like being in jail.

title: Dave McClure
content: Features are like having sex. You make one mistake and you have to support it for life.

title: Armin Vit
content: Never stand still. If you stand still, you get lost, because someone else is always moving.

title: God (from Futurama)
content: When you do things right, people won’t be sure you’ve done anything at all.

title: Bertrand Russell
content: In all affairs it’s a healthy thing now and then to hang a question mark on the things you have long taken for granted.

title: Larry Erickson
content: Using simpler forms and straightforward, easy-to-use instruments and controls allows you to achieve a very high level of craftsmanship. We then use color and texture to create a personality for each vehicle.

title: Dave Kotler
content: Copywriting is definitely the profession most written about.

title: Erik Adigard
content: Design is in everything we make, but it’s also between those things. It’s a mix of craft, science, storytelling, propaganda, and philosophy.

title: Chris Anderson
content: Easy is not to be underestimated. Easy taps the pool of talent and ideas out there that were turned off by hard.

title: Chris Clark
content: The process is really just Iterate, Iterate, Iterate.

title: Dan Phillips
content: Clients are full of surprises. Design is what you make of the surprises.

title: John D. Cook
content: When it comes to writing code, the number one most important skill is how to keep a tangle of features from collapsing under the weight of its own complexity.

title: Chad Mazzola
content: Nobody ever get fired for running an A/B test.

title: Sherlock Holmes
content: No, Watson, this was not done by accident, but by design.

title: Fiel Valdez
content: Every practice has a set of rules which governs it. Mastery occurs with the realization of these rules. Innovation occurs at the point of intelligent and creative rebellion against them.

title: Ryan Singer
content: Orient your UI around the job to be done — around the problem — and not the person. Then people who have that problem can fall in love with your product because it makes the problem go away, whether they are the first in line or the last person to hear about it.

title: Pete Episcopo
content: Everything we do communicates.

title: Mark Boulton
content: I think design covers so much more than the aesthetic. Design is fundamentally more. Design is usability. It is Information Architecture. It is Accessibility. This is all design.

title: Tom Bissel
content: To create anything–whether a short story or a magazine profile or a film or a sitcom–is to believe, if only momentarily, you are capable of magic.

title: Ross Lovegrove
content: I rarely agree with what clients ask me to do.

title: Wouter Stokkel
content: It’s art if it can’t be explained. It’s fashion if no one asks for an explanation. It’s design if it doesn’t need explanation.

title: Gertrude Stein
content: Everyone gets so much information all day long that they lose their common sense.

title: Paul Klee
content: Art does not reproduce what we see; rather, it makes us see.

title: Brian Fritzpatick
content: Do what I want, not what I say.

title: Ethan Marcotte
content: A friend once insisted to me that the plural of “moron” is “focus group.”

title: Bill Bernbach
content: Find the simple story in the product, and present it in an articulate and intelligent, persuasive way.
